*.name: multiply
*.description: The * function computes the value of a * b.

+.name: add
+.description: The + function computes the value of a + b.

-.name: subtract
-.description: The - function computed the value of a - b.

/.name: divide
/.description: The / function dividesvide the first argument by the second.

%.name: modulo
%.description: The % function returns the remainder of a divided by b.

=.name: equals
=.description: The equals function turns 1 if a and b are equal to each other, otherwise returns 0.

>.name: greater than
>.description: Returns 1 if a is a value strictly greater than b, otherwise returns 0.

<.name: less than
<.description: Returns 1 if a is a value strictly less than b, otherwise returns 0.

&.name: boolean and
&.description: Returns 1 if both a and b are greater than 0, otherwise returns 0.

|.name: boolean or
|.description: Returns 1 if either a or b are greater than 0, otherwise returns 0.

!.name: boolean not
!.description: Returns 0 if a is greater than 0. Returns 1 if a is equal to 0.

cons.name: construct list pair
cons.description: This operation is used to build lists by creating list pairs. The first argument can be any data type: number, symbol, or even another list. The second argument is optional. If provided it should be another list - either the result of a cons, or a quoted list.

car.name: car
car.description: Return the first element of the first list pair.

cdr.name: cdr
cdr.description: Return the second list pair of a list, or null if there are no more pairs in the list.

@.name: apply
@.description: Apply the list referenced by the first argument as if it were a function

beep.name: beep
beep.description: Play a musical note. The first argument is a number from 0-8 and represents a note on the musical scale. The second argument defines the duration of the note in clock ticks and can be any number from 0-999.

stack.name: stack
stack.description: Move a disk from stack a to stack b.

position.name: move object
position.description: Move player or ball. b = direction (up, down, left, right, xy), c = value (amount, x), d = value (momentum, y)

shape.name: change player shape and color
shape.description: Modify shape and color of player or ball. b = shape, c = color

joystick.name: read joystick direction
joystick.description: Read joystick/keypad directions. Returns a value from 1-12.

keypad.name: keypad input
keypad.description: Waits until a keypad controller button is pushed. Returns a value from 1-12.

cx.name: detect collision
cx.description: Detects collisions. Returns collision type (0 = p0/ball, 1 = p1/ball, 2 = p0/p1).

'.name: quote
'.description: The quote symbol is used to create static lists without evaluating them as code.

if.name: if
if.description: If is a special function. If the first argument is true will return the result of evaluating the second argument. Otherwise it will return the result of evaluating the third argument.

loop.name: loop
loop.description: Loop is a special function the repeatedly evaluates its arguments in a loop. It will only exit if the first argument returns false.

progn.name: progn
progn.description: Progn evaluates its arguments in order and returns the value of the last argument.
